Con artists, fraudsters,

00:02:25.122 --> 00:02:27.541
anyone who wanted to manipulate a grieving husband.

00:02:27.600 --> 00:02:29.640
I knew none of them were my wife.

00:02:29.641 --> 00:02:30.361
No, Daniel, wait.

00:02:30.362 --> 00:02:31.841
You have to listen to me. It is me.

00:02:31.842 --> 00:02:33.561
It's Sarah. You have to believe me.

00:02:33.562 --> 00:02:35.481
She was sounding shrill and desperate, now,

00:02:35.482 --> 00:02:36.941
even a little hysterical.

00:02:37.000 --> 00:02:40.380
The length that people go to in order to sell a lie is astonishing.

00:02:40.520 --> 00:02:42.280
Why are you doing this? I asked angrily.

00:02:42.281 --> 00:02:44.241
It's been 15 years since my wife disappeared.

00:02:44.242 --> 00:02:46.441
What do you want from me? For a moment,

00:02:46.442 --> 00:02:49.061
the woman on the other end of the line didn't respond.

00:02:49.200 --> 00:02:52.940
I was beginning to think that the call had disconnected

00:02:53.360 --> 00:02:54.900
when she finally spoke.

00:02:55.440 --> 00:02:56.280
Daniel, please,

00:02:56.281 --> 00:02:58.201
it's me. It's your wife, Sarah,

00:02:58.202 --> 00:03:00.161
the woman begged. I'm telling the truth.

00:03:00.162 --> 00:03:01.721
It's me, she continued to plead,

00:03:01.722 --> 00:03:03.921
but I'd had enough. I wasn't gonna listen anymore.

00:03:03.922 --> 00:03:06.161
Don't call this number again,

00:03:06.162 --> 00:03:07.901
I firmly told her, hanging up.

00:03:07.960 --> 00:03:09.200
I thought that would do it.

00:03:09.201 --> 00:03:10.641
She wouldn't be likely to call me again,

00:03:10.642 --> 00:03:12.561
and I assumed it was all over.

00:03:12.562 --> 00:03:15.601
The next day, I had asked a friend to help me repair my plumbing system.

00:03:15.602 --> 00:03:17.781
He was a good friend. I'd known him since college.

00:03:17.800 --> 00:03:19.600
He'd been there for me when Sarah disappeared,

00:03:19.601 --> 00:03:22.201
getting me through it. We were both taking a break,

00:03:22.202 --> 00:03:24.281
catching up on the important events in each other's lives,

00:03:24.282 --> 00:03:27.381
when my landline phone began to ring again.

00:03:28.160 --> 00:03:29.160
Sorry, I have to take this.

00:03:29.161 --> 00:03:30.701
It might Be important, I said.

00:03:30.760 --> 00:03:32.720
I noticed the calls from an unknown number,

00:03:32.721 --> 00:03:34.401
just as it had been the day before.

00:03:34.402 --> 00:03:35.881
I didn't make a connection right away.

00:03:35.882 --> 00:03:37.921
After all, it could have been the bank this time around.

00:03:37.922 --> 00:03:42.181
Picked up the phone, I heard the same rustling sound.

00:03:42.560 --> 00:03:44.200
It was unsettling in a strange way.

00:03:44.201 --> 00:03:45.761
Almost felt like I'd heard it before.

00:03:45.762 --> 00:03:48.141
I couldn't put my finger on it. Hello?

00:03:49.920 --> 00:03:51.400
I told you not to call this number.

00:03:51.401 --> 00:03:53.361
Daniel? Oh, Daniel,

00:03:53.362 --> 00:03:55.081
thank goodness I finally reached you.

00:03:55.082 --> 00:03:56.001
It's me, Sarah,

00:03:56.002 --> 00:03:58.701
are you there? It was undoubtedly the same woman.

00:03:58.880 --> 00:04:00.040
I don't have time for this.

00:04:00.041 --> 00:04:02.361
I know you're not Sarah. Stop calling me.

00:04:02.362 --> 00:04:03.241
Who was that? He asked me.

00:04:03.242 --> 00:04:04.281
I heard you saying Sarah's name.

00:04:04.282 --> 00:04:05.461
Is everything okay?

00:04:05.800 --> 00:04:08.320
It was just a prank caller trying to pretend to be Sarah,

00:04:08.321 --> 00:04:09.441
I told him, rolling my eyes.

00:04:09.442 --> 00:04:10.841
I thought that I left it all behind.

00:04:10.842 --> 00:04:11.961
I even changed my phone number.

00:04:11.962 --> 00:04:13.981
I don't know how this woman got hold of my new one.

00:04:14.760 --> 00:04:16.800
Pretending to be Sarah, a friend echoed.

00:04:16.801 --> 00:04:19.041
That's really strange. Did you tell anyone about it?

00:04:19.042 --> 00:04:20.781
Like the police? No,

00:04:20.960 --> 00:04:23.120
there's no need. It's just someone trying to cause a bit of drama.

00:04:23.121 --> 00:04:25.141
They probably want money or something like that.

00:04:25.200 --> 00:04:26.880
I didn't want to continue talking about it,

00:04:26.881 --> 00:04:29.501
bringing up harmful reminders of the past.

00:04:29.560 --> 00:04:30.840
I woke up the next day

00:04:30.841 --> 00:04:33.501
not expecting to get any more calls from the unknown number.

00:04:33.720 --> 00:04:36.560
I made it very clear. That I wouldn't be participating in her charade.

00:04:36.561 --> 00:04:39.401
However, I was quickly proven wrong.

00:04:39.402 --> 00:04:41.761
As soon as I started to walk downstairs for a glass of water,

00:04:41.762 --> 00:04:44.681
the phone rang again. I thought about letting it ring,

00:04:44.682 --> 00:04:46.041
but I had a better idea.

00:04:46.042 --> 00:04:48.461
I was gonna issue a much stronger warning to the caller.

00:04:48.520 --> 00:04:49.840
Or just listen. Just. Yeah,

00:04:49.841 --> 00:04:50.641
yeah, yeah.

00:04:50.642 --> 00:04:51.681
Or just listen. Yeah,

00:04:51.682 --> 00:04:52.881
I know, yeah.

00:04:52.882 --> 00:04:54.281
Imagine being, like,

00:04:54.282 --> 00:04:55.881
kidnapped or something, calling.

00:04:55.882 --> 00:04:57.201
Your husband's been like, fuck off.

00:04:57.202 --> 00:04:59.541
Yeah, he's never fucking seen me.

00:04:59.880 --> 00:05:01.340
Come rescue me.

00:05:01.920 --> 00:05:05.040
Picked up the phone, hearing the very same eerie rustling.

00:05:05.041 --> 00:05:07.861
I couldn't explain it, but it made a shiver run up my spine.

00:05:07.880 --> 00:05:09.700
Finally, the call connected.

00:05:09.840 --> 00:05:11.200
It was the same as the other times.

00:05:11.201 --> 00:05:12.761
The same pathetic monologue.

00:05:12.762 --> 00:05:14.161
Daniel? Daniel,

00:05:14.162 --> 00:05:15.481
thank goodness I finally reached you.

00:05:15.482 --> 00:05:16.881
Daniel, it's me, Sarah.

00:05:16.882 --> 00:05:19.721
Are you there? If you don't stop calling this number,

00:05:19.722 --> 00:05:21.361
I have no choice but to involve the police.

00:05:21.362 --> 00:05:23.241
This is harassment. If you want my money,

00:05:23.242 --> 00:05:24.741
try calling someone else.

00:05:25.040 --> 00:05:28.800
Before I could give the woman on the other line a chance to answer,

00:05:28.801 --> 00:05:30.401
I hung up the call. Hopefully,

00:05:30.402 --> 00:05:32.441
this would show her that she wouldn't be manipulating me.

00:05:32.442 --> 00:05:34.761
I could see right through her elaborate scam.

00:05:34.762 --> 00:05:37.361
I was sure that my warning would stop the calls coming in.

00:05:37.362 --> 00:05:40.241
I was so sure of myself that when I was woken by a loud,

00:05:40.242 --> 00:05:42.561
persistent ringing sound the next morning,

00:05:42.562 --> 00:05:45.801
I didn't even think to connect it to The unknown number calls first

00:05:45.802 --> 00:05:47.521
assumed it was my alarm waking me up.

00:05:47.522 --> 00:05:48.521
But when I turned to look,

00:05:48.522 --> 00:05:50.441
I saw that the alarm hadn't gone off yet.

00:05:50.442 --> 00:05:53.881
That was when I reached the conclusion it was the landline phone again.

00:05:53.882 --> 00:05:55.001
I rushed down the stairs,

00:05:55.002 --> 00:05:57.781
wanting to tell the caller that I would be taking police action.

00:05:58.040 --> 00:06:00.420
I got down there in time. When I picked up the phone,

00:06:00.440 --> 00:06:03.660
holding it to my ear, I heard the creepy rustling sound.

00:06:03.720 --> 00:06:05.500
It made my heart beat faster.

00:06:05.720 --> 00:06:06.520
Daniel?

00:06:06.960 --> 00:06:09.220
Daniel, thank goodness I finally reached you.

00:06:09.600 --> 00:06:10.640
Daniel, it's me, Sarah.

00:06:10.641 --> 00:06:13.041
Are you there? I gave you a warning.

00:06:13.042 --> 00:06:14.241
I said that if you called again,

00:06:14.242 --> 00:06:16.761
I take legal action. You've gone too far now.

00:06:16.762 --> 00:06:18.121
I have to do something about this.

00:06:18.122 --> 00:06:19.941
I waited for the woman to respond.

00:06:20.360 --> 00:06:21.160
Daniel,

00:06:21.600 --> 00:06:22.760
it's me. I'm not lying to you.

00:06:22.761 --> 00:06:24.561
I'd never lie to you. Daniel,

00:06:24.562 --> 00:06:25.321
it's me. Sarah,

00:06:25.322 --> 00:06:26.941
your wife. It's me.

00:06:27.560 --> 00:06:30.360
You're not Sarah. I told her bitterly.

00:06:30.361 --> 00:06:33.541
I know you're not Sarah. I will be taking action. Goodbye.

00:06:34.120 --> 00:06:36.300
I know that woman wasn't Sarah.

00:06:36.440 --> 00:06:38.260
I know for a fact she wasn't.

00:06:38.400 --> 00:06:40.620
I know it because on January the 7th, he killed

00:06:43.160 --> 00:06:45.880
Sarah Collins. Beloved member of the community was killed.

00:06:45.881 --> 00:06:47.661
And I was the one who killed her.

00:06:48.680 --> 00:06:50.240
Sarah. Okay.

00:06:50.241 --> 00:06:51.921
I did not see that one coming.

00:06:51.922 --> 00:06:56.301
Yeah, Sarah was shook ass.

00:06:56.680 --> 00:06:58.120
Shook ass. I can't lie.

00:06:58.121 --> 00:06:59.301
I did not see that coming.

00:06:59.400 --> 00:07:03.000
Fucking hell. Sarah was an incredibly beautiful woman.

00:07:03.001 --> 00:07:03.881
I Couldn't believe my luck

00:07:03.882 --> 00:07:06.041
when she first started showing interest in me.

00:07:06.042 --> 00:07:08.321
I didn't exactly have a lot of experience in talking to women,

00:07:08.322 --> 00:07:13.261
and I was ecstatic that someone like Sarah had chosen someone like me.

00:07:13.360 --> 00:07:17.060
Sarah. My Sarah was planning to leave me for him.

00:07:17.800 --> 00:07:19.080
I couldn't have that. So.

00:07:19.081 --> 00:07:20.921
She was so beautiful, so bright,

00:07:20.922 --> 00:07:22.641
so full of life. I couldn't lose her.

00:07:22.642 --> 00:07:25.761
I just couldn't lose her. So I killed her.

00:07:25.762 --> 00:07:27.601
I didn't have to think about it for long.

00:07:27.602 --> 00:07:29.201
It was the only way she would be mine.

00:07:29.202 --> 00:07:30.281
Only mine. Forever.

00:07:30.282 --> 00:07:32.041
If she was dead, she'd never leave me.

00:07:32.042 --> 00:07:36.281
She'd always be my Sarah. And when the police arrived,

00:07:36.282 --> 00:07:37.521
I made up an elaborate lie

00:07:37.522 --> 00:07:40.021
that she'd gone out to run an errand and never came home.

00:07:40.040 --> 00:07:43.220
The very same lie ended up on the headlines of national news.

00:07:43.440 --> 00:07:45.640
I didn't know if I'd ever even get away with it.

00:07:45.641 --> 00:07:47.441
But a year passed, then another year,

00:07:47.442 --> 00:07:50.121
and then another 15 years passed,

00:07:50.122 --> 00:07:52.261
and no one ever saw through me.

00:07:52.800 --> 00:07:55.140
I was about to walk back upstairs when I heard.

00:07:57.160 --> 00:07:59.660
Oh, getting at the window.

00:08:00.440 --> 00:08:02.220
The sound of a window opening.

00:08:02.240 --> 00:08:04.420
And that's when I heard it rustling.

00:08:04.680 --> 00:08:06.580
Right there in my house.

00:08:06.920 --> 00:08:10.260
Rustling that paralyzed me with fear and sent my mind into a panic.

00:08:10.520 --> 00:08:12.400
And then I heard it. Daniel?

00:08:12.401 --> 00:08:13.501
It's me, Sarah.

00:08:13.920 --> 00:08:15.760
It's me, Sarah.

00:08:15.761 --> 00:08:17.001
Thank God I finally got you there.

00:08:17.002 --> 00:08:20.481
Ha ha ha ha ha! Is that what you said?

00:08:20.482 --> 00:08:22.061
Oh, very good

WEBVTT


00:00:00.480 --> 00:00:02.440
My wife has been missing for 15 years.

00:00:02.441 --> 00:00:04.541
Until she called my phone out of the blue.

00:00:05.000 --> 00:00:07.280
I don't like to talk about what happened 15 years ago.

00:00:07.281 --> 00:00:10.601
I don't even like to think about the fact that on January the 7th,

00:00:10.602 --> 00:00:13.021
2,008, Sarah Collins,

00:00:13.200 --> 00:00:14.480
loved member of the community,

00:00:14.481 --> 00:00:17.201
left home to run an errand and was then never seen again.

00:00:17.202 --> 00:00:19.161
Love that. It was a huge case back then,

00:00:19.162 --> 00:00:20.961
and everyone seemed to want to know what happened to her.

00:00:20.962 --> 00:00:23.741
But no one was more desperate for answers than I was.

00:00:23.920 --> 00:00:26.320
Sarah and I'd been married for five years.

00:00:26.321 --> 00:00:27.681
I knew as soon as I met her

00:00:27.682 --> 00:00:29.521
that I wanted to spend the rest of my life with her.

00:00:29.522 --> 00:00:32.221
She had one of those smiles that just lit up a room.

00:00:32.280 --> 00:00:35.680
That's why it was so hard to believe that such a beautiful,

00:00:35.681 --> 00:00:38.541
successful woman had seemingly disappeared.

00:00:38.880 --> 00:00:40.560
They hadn't even recovered her body.

00:00:40.561 --> 00:00:43.941
15 years later, they still didn't have a shred of evidence.

00:00:43.960 --> 00:00:46.780
Not a tire track or a fingerprint. Nothing.

00:00:46.880 --> 00:00:48.160
The police put out an appeal,

00:00:48.161 --> 00:00:49.841
but no one came forward. Somehow

00:00:49.842 --> 00:00:51.701
not a single person had seen her.

00:00:51.880 --> 00:00:55.100
It was like she just vanished without a trace.

00:00:55.760 --> 00:00:57.280
I think about Sarah a lot.

00:00:57.281 --> 00:00:58.481
I can never quite bring myself

00:00:58.482 --> 00:01:00.861
to take down the photos of her from around the house.

00:01:01.120 --> 00:01:04.080
Sarah's bright face still smiles down at me from every room.

00:01:04.081 --> 00:01:07.261
There's one photo of her from our wedding day that I really love.

00:01:07.400 --> 00:01:09.400
Looking at it is like looking straight at her.

00:01:09.401 --> 00:01:10.801
It captured her perfectly.

00:01:10.802 --> 00:01:13.381
Two days ago I found myself staring at it,

00:01:13.400 --> 00:01:14.920
really getting lost in the details.

00:01:14.921 --> 00:01:18.581
Her eyes, the way the corners of her mouth were lifting into a smile.

00:01:18.600 --> 00:01:20.580
The small dimple on her left cheek.

00:01:20.880 --> 00:01:22.480
I was looking at it so intently

00:01:22.481 --> 00:01:24.701
that I almost didn't notice the phone ringing.

00:01:24.840 --> 00:01:25.960
It was the landline phone.

00:01:25.961 --> 00:01:28.621
Which is odd cause no one ever called me on the landline anymore.

00:01:28.640 --> 00:01:29.940
It was all mobiles nowadays.

00:01:30.040 --> 00:01:31.400
When I looked at the caller ID,

00:01:31.401 --> 00:01:34.981
it was an unknown number. I shrugged and picked it up anyway.

00:01:35.200 --> 00:01:37.820
Probably just the bank calling to confirm something.

00:01:38.040 --> 00:01:39.320
The call took a moment to connect,

00:01:39.321 --> 00:01:39.921
but when it did,

00:01:39.922 --> 00:01:45.021
I heard a strange rustling SoundOn the other end of the line. Hello?

00:01:45.560 --> 00:01:47.160
I wasn't in the mood for any prank callers.

00:01:47.161 --> 00:01:48.341
Is anyone there?

00:01:49.120 --> 00:01:50.060
Hello?

00:01:50.680 --> 00:01:53.120
Daniel? Oh, Daniel,

00:01:53.121 --> 00:01:54.901
thank goodness I finally reached you.

00:01:54.960 --> 00:01:57.640
The voice on the other end of the line was a woman's voice.

00:01:57.641 --> 00:01:59.181
It was shaking and breathless.

00:01:59.400 --> 00:02:00.660
Daniel, it's me.

00:02:00.800 --> 00:02:03.100
It's Sarah. Are you there?

00:02:03.280 --> 00:02:04.200
When I heard her name,

00:02:04.201 --> 00:02:06.581
it was like my heart stopped beating for a moment.

00:02:06.600 --> 00:02:08.660
Sarah? My Sarah.

00:02:08.840 --> 00:02:12.760
But that was impossible. Sarah had gone missing 15 years ago.

00:02:12.761 --> 00:02:15.541
Whoever this was was not my wife.

00:02:15.880 --> 00:02:17.480
I don't know who you are, but you're not Sarah.

00:02:17.481 --> 00:02:19.081
I hissed into the phone coldly.

00:02:19.082 --> 00:02:22.001
Stop calling this number! I dealt with a lot of these calls.

00:02:22.002 --> 00:02:23.841
Especially when Sarah first went missing.

00:02:23.842 --> 00:02:25.121
Con artists, fraudsters,

00:02:25.122 --> 00:02:27.541
anyone who wanted to manipulate a grieving husband.

00:02:27.600 --> 00:02:29.640
I knew none of them were my wife.

00:02:29.641 --> 00:02:30.361
No, Daniel, wait.

00:02:30.362 --> 00:02:31.841
You have to listen to me. It is me.

00:02:31.842 --> 00:02:33.561
It's Sarah. You have to believe me.

00:02:33.562 --> 00:02:35.481
She was sounding shrill and desperate, now,

00:02:35.482 --> 00:02:36.941
even a little hysterical.

00:02:37.000 --> 00:02:40.380
The length that people go to in order to sell a lie is astonishing.

00:02:40.520 --> 00:02:42.280
Why are you doing this? I asked angrily.

00:02:42.281 --> 00:02:44.241
It's been 15 years since my wife disappeared.

00:02:44.242 --> 00:02:46.441
What do you want from me? For a moment,

00:02:46.442 --> 00:02:49.061
the woman on the other end of the line didn't respond.

00:02:49.200 --> 00:02:52.940
I was beginning to think that the call had disconnected

00:02:53.360 --> 00:02:54.900
when she finally spoke.

00:02:55.440 --> 00:02:56.280
Daniel, please,

00:02:56.281 --> 00:02:58.201
it's me. It's your wife, Sarah,

00:02:58.202 --> 00:03:00.161
the woman begged. I'm telling the truth.

00:03:00.162 --> 00:03:01.721
It's me, she continued to plead,

00:03:01.722 --> 00:03:03.921
but I'd had enough. I wasn't gonna listen anymore.

00:03:03.922 --> 00:03:06.161
Don't call this number again,

00:03:06.162 --> 00:03:07.901
I firmly told her, hanging up.

00:03:07.960 --> 00:03:09.200
I thought that would do it.

00:03:09.201 --> 00:03:10.641
She wouldn't be likely to call me again,

00:03:10.642 --> 00:03:12.561
and I assumed it was all over.

00:03:12.562 --> 00:03:15.601
The next day, I had asked a friend to help me repair my plumbing system.

00:03:15.602 --> 00:03:17.781
He was a good friend. I'd known him since college.

00:03:17.800 --> 00:03:19.600
He'd been there for me when Sarah disappeared,

00:03:19.601 --> 00:03:22.201
getting me through it. We were both taking a break,

00:03:22.202 --> 00:03:24.281
catching up on the important events in each other's lives,

00:03:24.282 --> 00:03:27.381
when my landline phone began to ring again.

00:03:28.160 --> 00:03:29.160
Sorry, I have to take this.

00:03:29.161 --> 00:03:30.701
It might Be important, I said.

00:03:30.760 --> 00:03:32.720
I noticed the calls from an unknown number,

00:03:32.721 --> 00:03:34.401
just as it had been the day before.

00:03:34.402 --> 00:03:35.881
I didn't make a connection right away.

00:03:35.882 --> 00:03:37.921
After all, it could have been the bank this time around.

00:03:37.922 --> 00:03:42.181
Picked up the phone, I heard the same rustling sound.

00:03:42.560 --> 00:03:44.200
It was unsettling in a strange way.

00:03:44.201 --> 00:03:45.761
Almost felt like I'd heard it before.

00:03:45.762 --> 00:03:48.141
I couldn't put my finger on it. Hello?

00:03:49.920 --> 00:03:51.400
I told you not to call this number.

00:03:51.401 --> 00:03:53.361
Daniel? Oh, Daniel,

00:03:53.362 --> 00:03:55.081
thank goodness I finally reached you.

00:03:55.082 --> 00:03:56.001
It's me, Sarah,

00:03:56.002 --> 00:03:58.701
are you there? It was undoubtedly the same woman.

00:03:58.880 --> 00:04:00.040
I don't have time for this.

00:04:00.041 --> 00:04:02.361
I know you're not Sarah. Stop calling me.

00:04:02.362 --> 00:04:03.241
Who was that? He asked me.

00:04:03.242 --> 00:04:04.281
I heard you saying Sarah's name.

00:04:04.282 --> 00:04:05.461
Is everything okay?

00:04:05.800 --> 00:04:08.320
It was just a prank caller trying to pretend to be Sarah,

00:04:08.321 --> 00:04:09.441
I told him, rolling my eyes.

00:04:09.442 --> 00:04:10.841

WEBVTT


00:00:00.480 --> 00:00:02.440
My wife has been missing for 15 years.

00:00:02.441 --> 00:00:04.541
Until she called my phone out of the blue.

00:00:05.000 --> 00:00:07.280
I don't like to talk about what happened 15 years ago.

00:00:07.281 --> 00:00:10.601
I don't even like to think about the fact that on January the 7th,

00:00:10.602 --> 00:00:13.021
2,008, Sarah Collins,

00:00:13.200 --> 00:00:14.480
loved member of the community,

00:00:14.481 --> 00:00:17.201
left home to run an errand and was then never seen again.

00:00:17.202 --> 00:00:19.161
Love that. It was a huge case back then,

00:00:19.162 --> 00:00:20.961
and everyone seemed to want to know what happened to her.

00:00:20.962 --> 00:00:23.741
But no one was more desperate for answers than I was.

00:00:23.920 --> 00:00:26.320
Sarah and I'd been married for five years.

00:00:26.321 --> 00:00:27.681
I knew as soon as I met her

00:00:27.682 --> 00:00:29.521
that I wanted to spend the rest of my life with her.

00:00:29.522 --> 00:00:32.221
She had one of those smiles that just lit up a room.

00:00:32.280 --> 00:00:35.680
That's why it was so hard to believe that such a beautiful,

00:00:35.681 --> 00:00:38.541
successful woman had seemingly disappeared.

00:00:38.880 --> 00:00:40.560
They hadn't even recovered her body.

00:00:40.561 --> 00:00:43.941
15 years later, they still didn't have a shred of evidence.

00:00:43.960 --> 00:00:46.780
Not a tire track or a fingerprint. Nothing.

00:00:46.880 --> 00:00:48.160
The police put out an appeal,

00:00:48.161 --> 00:00:49.841
but no one came forward. Somehow

00:00:49.842 --> 00:00:51.701
not a single person had seen her.

00:00:51.880 --> 00:00:55.100
It was like she just vanished without a trace.

00:00:55.760 --> 00:00:57.280
I think about Sarah a lot.

00:00:57.281 --> 00:00:58.481
I can never quite bring myself

00:00:58.482 --> 00:01:00.861
to take down the photos of her from around the house.

00:01:01.120 --> 00:01:04.080
Sarah's bright face still smiles down at me from every room.

00:01:04.081 --> 00:01:07.261
There's one photo of her from our wedding day that I really love.

00:01:07.400 --> 00:01:09.400
Looking at it is like looking straight at her.

00:01:09.401 --> 00:01:10.801
It captured her perfectly.

00:01:10.802 --> 00:01:13.381
Two days ago I found myself staring at it,

00:01:13.400 --> 00:01:14.920
really getting lost in the details.

00:01:14.921 --> 00:01:18.581
Her eyes, the way the corners of her mouth were lifting into a smile.

00:01:18.600 --> 00:01:20.580
The small dimple on her left cheek.

00:01:20.880 --> 00:01:22.480
I was looking at it so intently

00:01:22.481 --> 00:01:24.701

00:01:24.840 --> 00:01:25.960
It was the landline phone.

00:01:25.961 --> 00:01:28.621
Which is odd cause no one ever called me on the landline anymore.

00:01:28.640 --> 00:01:29.940
It was all mobiles nowadays.

00:01:30.040 --> 00:01:31.400

00:01:31.401 --> 00:01:34.981

00:01:35.200 --> 00:01:37.820
Probably just the bank calling to confirm something.

00:01:38.040 --> 00:01:39.320
The call took a moment to connect,

00:01:39.321 --> 00:01:39.921

00:01:39.922 --> 00:01:45.021

00:00:00.480 --> 00:00:02.440
My wife has been missing for 15 years.

00:00:02.441 --> 00:00:04.541

00:00:05.000 --> 00:00:07.280

00:00:10.602 --> 00:00:13.021
2,008, Sarah Collins,

loved member of the community,

00:00:14.481 --> 00:00:17.201
left home to run an errand and was then never seen again.

00:00:19.162 --> 00:00:20.961
and everyone seemed to want to know what happened to her.

00:00:20.962 --> 00:00:23.741
But no one was more desperate for answers than I was.

00:00:23.920 --> 00:00:26.320
Sarah and I'd been married for five years.

00:00:26.321 --> 00:00:27.681
I knew as soon as I met her

00:00:27.682 --> 00:00:29.521

00:00:29.522 --> 00:00:32.221
She had one of those smiles that just lit up a room.

00:00:32.280 --> 00:00:35.680
That's why it was so hard to believe that such a beautiful,

00:00:35.681 --> 00:00:38.541
successful woman had seemingly disappeared.

00:00:38.880 --> 00:00:40.560
They hadn't even recovered her body.

00:00:40.561 --> 00:00:43.941

00:00:43.960 --> 00:00:46.780
Not a tire track or a fingerprint. Nothing.

00:00:46.880 --> 00:00:48.160
The police put out an appeal,

00:00:48.161 --> 00:00:49.841
but no one came forward. Somehow

00:00:49.842 --> 00:00:51.701
not a single person had seen her.

00:00:51.880 --> 00:00:55.100
It was like she just vanished without a trace.

00:00:55.760 --> 00:00:57.280

00:00:57.281 --> 00:00:58.481

00:00:58.482 --> 00:01:00.861

00:08:00.440 --> 00:08:02.220
The sound of a window opening.

00:08:02.240 --> 00:08:04.420
And that's when I heard it rustling.

00:08:04.680 --> 00:08:06.580
Right there in my house.

00:08:06.920 --> 00:08:10.260
Rustling that paralyzed me with fear and sent my mind into a panic.

00:08:10.520 --> 00:08:12.400
And then I heard it. Daniel?

00:08:12.401 --> 00:08:13.501
It's me, Sarah.

00:08:13.920 --> 00:08:15.760
It's me, Sarah.

00:08:15.761 --> 00:08:17.001
Thank God I finally got you there.

00:08:17.002 --> 00:08:20.481
Ha ha ha ha ha! Is that what you said?

00:08:20.482 --> 00:08:22.061
Oh, very good
